title: WhatsApp users can now use Chat Lock to secure private or sensitive chats
description: Chat Lock puts chats into their own folders, requiring a passcode or biometric scan to access them.

title: Bluesky Social just took a big open-source step forward
description: The hot new social network from Twitter's founders has open-sourced its client software. Here's why that matters.

title: Google follows OpenAI in saying almost nothing about its new PaLM 2 AI program
description: Like OpenAI, the search engine giant is going back on decades of open publishing in AI research.

title: Linux security: What is sudo and why is it so important?
description: Sudo stands for "superuser do" and effectively gives a regular user access to administrator-like powers. Here's how to use this powerful tool.

title: How to convert documents to e-books the easy way
description: If you are either an indie author or someone who just needs long documents transformed into e-books for distribution, there's a very easy way of doing so.

title: Apple devices are about to get a bunch of new accessibility features
description: For Global Accessibility Awareness Day, Apple announced a comprehensive list of new assistive tech updates. Here's what to know.

title: Amazon is working on its own AI chatbot to assist its shoppers
description: New job postings spotted online reveal clues about the e-commerce giant's generative AI plans. Here's what we know.

title: Log in or lose it: Google will start deleting your unused personal accounts
description: Any account that hasn't been signed into for at least two years could have its content removed from Gmail, Docs, Drive, Calendar, YouTube, and Photos. Here's what to know.

title: How to encrypt your email (and why you should)
description: If you send emails with sensitive or private info inside, you should consider email encryption. Here's what to know.

title: I spent $130 on these reading glasses and can never go back to cheap readers
description: You owe it to yourself to spend a bit of extra money for a pair that can actually keep your eyes free of strain.

title: Suicide-related Google searches to yield message templates for seeking help
description: For people in crisis, the prewritten messages are designed to remove some of the difficulty and stigma involved in reaching out to another person.

title: Two phone makers dominate this year's customer satisfaction index - and I'm not surprised
description: The latest American Customer Satisfaction Index survey results are in, and the difference between the very best comes down to a point.

title: This $180 Android tablet is capable of things my iPad Pro can only dream of
description: Want a cheap, large-screen tablet that can take a hit? This one from Oukitel is worth a look.

title: These 4 popular Microsoft apps are getting a big AI boost
description: Microsoft is adding new AI features to Bing, Swiftkey, Skype and Edge. Here's what to know.

title: Cloud specialists get the big bucks, but there's still a role for generalists
description: Specialized cloud skills, such as AI and analytics, carry very hefty premiums.

title: How to create a shortcut to your Android Downloads folder on your home screen
description: If you're looking for a quick and easy method of accessing the Downloads folder on your Android device, the solution is built right into the Files app.

title: This official Ubuntu Spin might be just be the perfect intro to Linux
description: From the second you log in, and are greeted by the Budgie Welcome app, you'll feel right at home.

title: Zoom adds its own AI assistant named Claude
description: Zoom is making a new bet on AI by partnering with Anthropic to improve customer service.
